name: Rudin|exercise_1_1b
nl_statement: If $r$ is rational $(r \neq 0)$ and $x$ is irrational, prove that $rx$ is irrational.

name: Rudin|exercise_1_4
nl_statement: Let $E$ be a nonempty subset of an ordered set; suppose $\alpha$ is a lower bound of $E$ and $\beta$ is an upper bound of $E$. Prove that $\alpha \leq \beta$.

name: Rudin|exercise_1_8
nl_statement: Prove that no order can be defined in the complex field that turns it into an ordered field.

name: Rudin|exercise_1_12
nl_statement: If $z_1, \ldots, z_n$ are complex, prove that $|z_1 + z_2 + \ldots + z_n| \leq |z_1| + |z_2| + \cdots + |z_n|$.

name: Rudin|exercise_1_14
nl_statement: If $z$ is a complex number such that $|z|=1$, that is, such that $z \bar{z}=1$, compute $|1+z|^{2}+|1-z|^{2}$.

name: Rudin|exercise_1_17
nl_statement: Prove that $|\mathbf{x}+\mathbf{y}|^{2}+|\mathbf{x}-\mathbf{y}|^{2}=2|\mathbf{x}|^{2}+2|\mathbf{y}|^{2}$ if $\mathbf{x} \in R^{k}$ and $\mathbf{y} \in R^{k}$.

name: Rudin|exercise_1_18b
nl_statement: If $k = 1$ and $\mathbf{x} \in R^{k}$, prove that there does not exist $\mathbf{y} \in R^{k}$ such that $\mathbf{y} \neq 0$ but $\mathbf{x} \cdot \mathbf{y}=0$

name: Rudin|exercise_2_19a
nl_statement: If $A$ and $B$ are disjoint closed sets in some metric space $X$, prove that they are separated.

name: Rudin|exercise_2_25
nl_statement: Prove that every compact metric space $K$ has a countable base.

name: Rudin|exercise_2_27b
nl_statement: Suppose $E\subset\mathbb{R}^k$ is uncountable, and let $P$ be the set of condensation points of $E$. Prove that at most countably many points of $E$ are not in $P$.

name: Rudin|exercise_2_29
nl_statement: Prove that every open set in $\mathbb{R}$ is the union of an at most countable collection of disjoint segments.

name: Rudin|exercise_3_2a
nl_statement: Prove that $\lim_{n \rightarrow \infty}\sqrt{n^2 + n} -n = 1/2$.

name: Rudin|exercise_3_5
nl_statement: For any two real sequences $\left\{a_{n}\right\},\left\{b_{n}\right\}$, prove that $\limsup _{n \rightarrow \infty}\left(a_{n}+b_{n}\right) \leq \limsup _{n \rightarrow \infty} a_{n}+\limsup _{n \rightarrow \infty} b_{n},$ provided the sum on the right is not of the form $\infty-\infty$.

name: Rudin|exercise_3_7
nl_statement: Prove that the convergence of $\Sigma a_{n}$ implies the convergence of $\sum \frac{\sqrt{a_{n}}}{n}$ if $a_n\geq 0$.

name: Rudin|exercise_3_13
nl_statement: Prove that the Cauchy product of two absolutely convergent series converges absolutely.

name: Rudin|exercise_3_21
nl_statement: If $\left\{E_{n}\right\}$ is a sequence of closed nonempty and bounded sets in a complete metric space $X$, if $E_{n} \supset E_{n+1}$, and if $\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \operatorname{diam} E_{n}=0,$ then $\bigcap_{1}^{\infty} E_{n}$ consists of exactly one point.

name: Rudin|exercise_4_1a
nl_statement: Suppose $f$ is a real function defined on $\mathbb{R}$ which satisfies $\lim_{h \rightarrow 0} f(x + h) - f(x - h) = 0$ for every $x \in \mathbb{R}$. Show that $f$ does not need to be continuous.

name: Rudin|exercise_4_3
nl_statement: Let $f$ be a continuous real function on a metric space $X$. Let $Z(f)$ (the zero set of $f$ ) be the set of all $p \in X$ at which $f(p)=0$. Prove that $Z(f)$ is closed.

name: Rudin|exercise_4_4b
nl_statement: Let $f$ and $g$ be continuous mappings of a metric space $X$ into a metric space $Y$, and let $E$ be a dense subset of $X$. Prove that if $g(p) = f(p)$ for all $p \in P$ then $g(p) = f(p)$ for all $p \in X$.

name: Rudin|exercise_4_5b
nl_statement: Show that there exist a set $E \subset \mathbb{R}$ and a real continuous function $f$ defined on $E$, such that there does not exist a continuous real function $g$ on $\mathbb{R}$ such that $g(x)=f(x)$ for all $x \in E$.

name: Rudin|exercise_4_8a
nl_statement: Let $f$ be a real uniformly continuous function on the bounded set $E$ in $R^{1}$. Prove that $f$ is bounded on $E$.

name: Rudin|exercise_4_11a
nl_statement: Suppose $f$ is a uniformly continuous mapping of a metric space $X$ into a metric space $Y$ and prove that $\left\{f\left(x_{n}\right)\right\}$ is a Cauchy sequence in $Y$ for every Cauchy sequence $\{x_n\}$ in $X$.

name: Rudin|exercise_4_15
nl_statement: Prove that every continuous open mapping of $R^{1}$ into $R^{1}$ is monotonic.

name: Rudin|exercise_4_21a
nl_statement: Suppose $K$ and $F$ are disjoint sets in a metric space $X, K$ is compact, $F$ is closed. Prove that there exists $\delta>0$ such that $d(p, q)>\delta$ if $p \in K, q \in F$.

name: Rudin|exercise_5_1
nl_statement: Let $f$ be defined for all real $x$, and suppose that $|f(x)-f(y)| \leq (x-y)^{2}$ for all real $x$ and $y$. Prove that $f$ is constant.

name: Rudin|exercise_5_3
nl_statement: Suppose $g$ is a real function on $R^{1}$, with bounded derivative (say $\left|g^{\prime}\right| \leq M$ ). Fix $\varepsilon>0$, and define $f(x)=x+\varepsilon g(x)$. Prove that $f$ is one-to-one if $\varepsilon$ is small enough.

name: Rudin|exercise_5_5
nl_statement: Suppose $f$ is defined and differentiable for every $x>0$, and $f^{\prime}(x) \rightarrow 0$ as $x \rightarrow+\infty$. Put $g(x)=f(x+1)-f(x)$. Prove that $g(x) \rightarrow 0$ as $x \rightarrow+\infty$.

name: Rudin|exercise_5_7
nl_statement: Suppose $f^{\prime}(x), g^{\prime}(x)$ exist, $g^{\prime}(x) \neq 0$, and $f(x)=g(x)=0$. Prove that $\lim _{t \rightarrow x} \frac{f(t)}{g(t)}=\frac{f^{\prime}(x)}{g^{\prime}(x)}.$

name: Rudin|exercise_5_17
nl_statement: Suppose $f$ is a real, three times differentiable function on $[-1,1]$, such that $f(-1)=0, \quad f(0)=0, \quad f(1)=1, \quad f^{\prime}(0)=0 .$ Prove that $f^{(3)}(x) \geq 3$ for some $x \in(-1,1)$.

name: Munkres|exercise_13_3b
nl_statement: Show that the collection $$\mathcal{T}_\infty = \{U | X - U \text{ is infinite or empty or all of X}\}$$ does not need to be a topology on the set $X$.

name: Munkres|exercise_13_4a2
nl_statement: If $\mathcal{T}_\alpha$ is a family of topologies on $X$, show that $\bigcup \mathcal{T}_\alpha$ does not need to be a topology on $X$.

name: Munkres|exercise_13_4b2
nl_statement: Let $\mathcal{T}_\alpha$ be a family of topologies on $X$. Show that there is a unique largest topology on $X$ contained in all the collections $\mathcal{T}_\alpha$.

name: Munkres|exercise_13_5b
nl_statement: Show that if $\mathcal{A}$ is a subbasis for a topology on $X$, then the topology generated by $\mathcal{A}$ equals the intersection of all topologies on $X$ that contain $\mathcal{A}$.

name: Munkres|exercise_13_8a
nl_statement: Show that the collection $\{(a,b) \mid a < b, a \text{ and } b \text{ rational}\}$ is a basis that generates the standard topology on $\mathbb{R}$.

name: Munkres|exercise_16_1
nl_statement: Show that if $Y$ is a subspace of $X$, and $A$ is a subset of $Y$, then the topology $A$ inherits as a subspace of $Y$ is the same as the topology it inherits as a subspace of $X$.

name: Munkres|exercise_16_6
nl_statement: Show that the countable collection \[\{(a, b) \times (c, d) \mid a < b \text{ and } c < d, \text{ and } a, b, c, d \text{ are rational}\}\] is a basis for $\mathbb{R}^2$.

name: Munkres|exercise_18_8a
nl_statement: Let $Y$ be an ordered set in the order topology. Let $f, g: X \rightarrow Y$ be continuous. Show that the set $\{x \mid f(x) \leq g(x)\}$ is closed in $X$.

name: Munkres|exercise_18_13
nl_statement: Let $A \subset X$; let $f: A \rightarrow Y$ be continuous; let $Y$ be Hausdorff. Show that if $f$ may be extended to a continuous function $g: \bar{A} \rightarrow Y$, then $g$ is uniquely determined by $f$.

name: Munkres|exercise_20_2
nl_statement: Show that $\mathbb{R} \times \mathbb{R}$ in the dictionary order topology is metrizable.

name: Munkres|exercise_21_6b
nl_statement: Define $f_{n}:[0,1] \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$ by the equation $f_{n}(x)=x^{n}$. Show that the sequence $\left(f_{n}\right)$ does not converge uniformly.

name: Munkres|exercise_22_2a
nl_statement: Let $p: X \rightarrow Y$ be a continuous map. Show that if there is a continuous map $f: Y \rightarrow X$ such that $p \circ f$ equals the identity map of $Y$, then $p$ is a quotient map.

name: Munkres|exercise_22_5
nl_statement: Let $p \colon X \rightarrow Y$ be an open map. Show that if $A$ is open in $X$, then the map $q \colon A \rightarrow p(A)$ obtained by restricting $p$ is an open map.

name: Munkres|exercise_23_3
nl_statement: Let $\left\{A_{\alpha}\right\}$ be a collection of connected subspaces of $X$; let $A$ be a connected subset of $X$. Show that if $A \cap A_{\alpha} \neq \varnothing$ for all $\alpha$, then $A \cup\left(\bigcup A_{\alpha}\right)$ is connected.

name: Munkres|exercise_23_6
nl_statement: Let $A \subset X$. Show that if $C$ is a connected subspace of $X$ that intersects both $A$ and $X-A$, then $C$ intersects $\operatorname{Bd} A$.

name: Munkres|exercise_23_11
nl_statement: Let $p: X \rightarrow Y$ be a quotient map. Show that if each set $p^{-1}(\{y\})$ is connected, and if $Y$ is connected, then $X$ is connected.

name: Munkres|exercise_24_3a
nl_statement: Let $f \colon X \rightarrow X$ be continuous. Show that if $X = [0, 1]$, there is a point $x$ such that $f(x) = x$. (The point $x$ is called a fixed point of $f$.)

name: Munkres|exercise_25_9
nl_statement: Let $G$ be a topological group; let $C$ be the component of $G$ containing the identity element $e$. Show that $C$ is a normal subgroup of $G$.

name: Munkres|exercise_26_12
nl_statement: Let $p: X \rightarrow Y$ be a closed continuous surjective map such that $p^{-1}(\{y\})$ is compact, for each $y \in Y$. (Such a map is called a perfect map.) Show that if $Y$ is compact, then $X$ is compact.

name: Munkres|exercise_28_4
nl_statement: A space $X$ is said to be countably compact if every countable open covering of $X$ contains a finite subcollection that covers $X$. Show that for a $T_1$ space $X$, countable compactness is equivalent to limit point compactness.

name: Munkres|exercise_28_6
nl_statement: Let $(X, d)$ be a metric space. If $f: X \rightarrow X$ satisfies the condition $d(f(x), f(y))=d(x, y)$ for all $x, y \in X$, then $f$ is called an isometry of $X$. Show that if $f$ is an isometry and $X$ is compact, then $f$ is bijective and hence a homeomorphism.

name: Munkres|exercise_29_4
nl_statement: Show that $[0, 1]^\omega$ is not locally compact in the uniform topology.

name: Munkres|exercise_30_10
nl_statement: Show that if $X$ is a countable product of spaces having countable dense subsets, then $X$ has a countable dense subset.

name: Munkres|exercise_31_1
nl_statement: Show that if $X$ is regular, every pair of points of $X$ have neighborhoods whose closures are disjoint.

name: Munkres|exercise_31_3
nl_statement: Show that every order topology is regular.

name: Munkres|exercise_32_2a
nl_statement: Show that if $\prod X_\alpha$ is Hausdorff, then so is $X_\alpha$. Assume that each $X_\alpha$ is nonempty.

name: Munkres|exercise_32_2c
nl_statement: Show that if $\prod X_\alpha$ is normal, then so is $X_\alpha$. Assume that each $X_\alpha$ is nonempty.

name: Munkres|exercise_33_7
nl_statement: Show that every locally compact Hausdorff space is completely regular.

name: Munkres|exercise_34_9
nl_statement: Let $X$ be a compact Hausdorff space that is the union of the closed subspaces $X_1$ and $X_2$. If $X_1$ and $X_2$ are metrizable, show that $X$ is metrizable.

name: Munkres|exercise_43_2
nl_statement: Let $(X, d_X)$ and $(Y, d_Y)$ be metric spaces; let $Y$ be complete. Let $A \subset X$. Show that if $f \colon A \rightarrow Y$ is uniformly continuous, then $f$ can be uniquely extended to a continuous function $g \colon \bar{A} \rightarrow Y$, and $g$ is uniformly continuous.

name: Axler|exercise_1_2
nl_statement: Show that $\frac{-1 + \sqrt{3}i}{2}$ is a cube root of 1 (meaning that its cube equals 1).

name: Axler|exercise_1_4
nl_statement: Prove that if $a \in \mathbf{F}$, $v \in V$, and $av = 0$, then $a = 0$ or $v = 0$.

name: Axler|exercise_1_7
nl_statement: Give an example of a nonempty subset $U$ of $\mathbf{R}^2$ such that $U$ is closed under scalar multiplication, but $U$ is not a subspace of $\mathbf{R}^2$.

name: Axler|exercise_1_9
nl_statement: Prove that the union of two subspaces of $V$ is a subspace of $V$ if and only if one of the subspaces is contained in the other.

name: Axler|exercise_3_8
nl_statement: Suppose that $V$ is finite dimensional and that $T \in \mathcal{L}(V, W)$. Prove that there exists a subspace $U$ of $V$ such that $U \cap \operatorname{null} T=\{0\}$ and range $T=\{T u: u \in U\}$.

name: Axler|exercise_5_1
nl_statement: Suppose $T \in \mathcal{L}(V)$. Prove that if $U_{1}, \ldots, U_{m}$ are subspaces of $V$ invariant under $T$, then $U_{1}+\cdots+U_{m}$ is invariant under $T$.

name: Axler|exercise_5_11
nl_statement: Suppose $S, T \in \mathcal{L}(V)$. Prove that $S T$ and $T S$ have the same eigenvalues.

name: Axler|exercise_5_13
nl_statement: Suppose $T \in \mathcal{L}(V)$ is such that every subspace of $V$ with dimension $\operatorname{dim} V-1$ is invariant under $T$. Prove that $T$ is a scalar multiple of the identity operator.

name: Axler|exercise_5_24
nl_statement: Suppose $V$ is a real vector space and $T \in \mathcal{L}(V)$ has no eigenvalues. Prove that every subspace of $V$ invariant under $T$ has even dimension.

name: Axler|exercise_6_3
nl_statement: Prove that $\left(\sum_{j=1}^{n} a_{j} b_{j}\right)^{2} \leq\left(\sum_{j=1}^{n} j a_{j}{ }^{2}\right)\left(\sum_{j=1}^{n} \frac{b_{j}{ }^{2}}{j}\right)$ for all real numbers $a_{1}, \ldots, a_{n}$ and $b_{1}, \ldots, b_{n}$.

name: Axler|exercise_6_13
nl_statement: Suppose $\left(e_{1}, \ldots, e_{m}\right)$ is an or thonormal list of vectors in $V$. Let $v \in V$. Prove that $\|v\|^{2}=\left|\left\langle v, e_{1}\right\rangle\right|^{2}+\cdots+\left|\left\langle v, e_{m}\right\rangle\right|^{2}$ if and only if $v \in \operatorname{span}\left(e_{1}, \ldots, e_{m}\right)$.

name: Axler|exercise_7_5
nl_statement: Show that if $\operatorname{dim} V \geq 2$, then the set of normal operators on $V$ is not a subspace of $\mathcal{L}(V)$.

name: Axler|exercise_7_9
nl_statement: Prove that a normal operator on a complex inner-product space is self-adjoint if and only if all its eigenvalues are real.

name: Axler|exercise_7_11
nl_statement: Suppose $V$ is a complex inner-product space. Prove that every normal operator on $V$ has a square root. (An operator $S \in \mathcal{L}(V)$ is called a square root of $T \in \mathcal{L}(V)$ if $S^{2}=T$.)

name: Ireland-Rosen|exercise_1_30
nl_statement: Prove that $\frac{1}{2}+\frac{1}{3}+\cdots+\frac{1}{n}$ is not an integer.

name: Ireland-Rosen|exercise_2_4
nl_statement: If $a$ is a nonzero integer, then for $n>m$ show that $\left(a^{2^{n}}+1, a^{2^{m}}+1\right)=1$ or 2 depending on whether $a$ is odd or even.

name: Ireland-Rosen|exercise_2_27a
nl_statement: Show that $\sum^{\prime} 1 / n$, the sum being over square free integers, diverges.

name: Ireland-Rosen|exercise_3_4
nl_statement: Show that the equation $3 x^{2}+2=y^{2}$ has no solution in integers.

name: Ireland-Rosen|exercise_3_10
nl_statement: If $n$ is not a prime, show that $(n-1) ! \equiv 0(n)$, except when $n=4$.

name: Ireland-Rosen|exercise_4_4
nl_statement: Consider a prime $p$ of the form $4 t+1$. Show that $a$ is a primitive root modulo $p$ iff $-a$ is a primitive root modulo $p$.

name: Ireland-Rosen|exercise_4_6
nl_statement: If $p=2^{n}+1$ is a Fermat prime, show that 3 is a primitive root modulo $p$.

name: Ireland-Rosen|exercise_4_11
nl_statement: Prove that $1^{k}+2^{k}+\cdots+(p-1)^{k} \equiv 0(p)$ if $p-1 \nmid k$ and $-1(p)$ if $p-1 \mid k$.

name: Ireland-Rosen|exercise_5_28
nl_statement: Show that $x^{4} \equiv 2(p)$ has a solution for $p \equiv 1(4)$ iff $p$ is of the form $A^{2}+64 B^{2}$.

name: Ireland-Rosen|exercise_12_12
nl_statement: Show that $\sin (\pi / 12)$ is an algebraic number.

name: Shakarchi|exercise_1_13b
nl_statement: Suppose that $f$ is holomorphic in an open set $\Omega$. Prove that if $\text{Im}(f)$ is constant, then $f$ is constant.

name: Shakarchi|exercise_1_19a
nl_statement: Prove that the power series $\sum nz^n$ does not converge on any point of the unit circle.

name: Shakarchi|exercise_1_19c
nl_statement: Prove that the power series $\sum zn/n$ converges at every point of the unit circle except $z = 1$.

name: Shakarchi|exercise_2_2
nl_statement: Show that $\int_{0}^{\infty} \frac{\sin x}{x} d x=\frac{\pi}{2}$.

name: Shakarchi|exercise_2_13
nl_statement: Suppose $f$ is an analytic function defined everywhere in $\mathbb{C}$ and such that for each $z_0 \in \mathbb{C}$ at least one coefficient in the expansion $f(z) = \sum_{n=0}^\infty c_n(z - z_0)^n$ is equal to 0. Prove that $f$ is a polynomial.

name: Shakarchi|exercise_3_4
nl_statement: Show that $ \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} \frac{x \sin x}{x^2 + a^2} dx = \pi e^{-a}$ for $a > 0$.

name: Shakarchi|exercise_3_14
nl_statement: Prove that all entire functions that are also injective take the form $f(z) = az + b$, $a, b \in \mathbb{C}$ and $a \neq 0$.

name: Shakarchi|exercise_5_1
nl_statement: Prove that if $f$ is holomorphic in the unit disc, bounded and not identically zero, and $z_{1}, z_{2}, \ldots, z_{n}, \ldots$ are its zeros $\left(\left|z_{k}\right|<1\right)$, then $\sum_{n}\left(1-\left|z_{n}\right|\right)<\infty$.

name: Putnam|exercise_2018_a5
nl_statement: Let $f: \mathbb{R} \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$ be an infinitely differentiable function satisfying $f(0)=0, f(1)=1$, and $f(x) \geq 0$ for all $x \in$ $\mathbb{R}$. Show that there exist a positive integer $n$ and a real number $x$ such that $f^{(n)}(x)<0$.

name: Putnam|exercise_2018_b4
nl_statement: Given a real number $a$, we define a sequence by $x_{0}=1$, $x_{1}=x_{2}=a$, and $x_{n+1}=2 x_{n} x_{n-1}-x_{n-2}$ for $n \geq 2$. Prove that if $x_{n}=0$ for some $n$, then the sequence is periodic.

name: Putnam|exercise_2014_a5
nl_statement: Let

name: Putnam|exercise_2001_a5
nl_statement: Prove that there are unique positive integers $a, n$ such that $a^{n+1}-(a+1)^n=2001$.

name: Putnam|exercise_1999_b4
nl_statement: Let $f$ be a real function with a continuous third derivative such that $f(x), f^{\prime}(x), f^{\prime \prime}(x), f^{\prime \prime \prime}(x)$ are positive for all $x$. Suppose that $f^{\prime \prime \prime}(x) \leq f(x)$ for all $x$. Show that $f^{\prime}(x)<2 f(x)$ for all $x$.

name: Putnam|exercise_1998_b6
nl_statement: Prove that, for any integers $a, b, c$, there exists a positive integer $n$ such that $\sqrt{n^3+a n^2+b n+c}$ is not an integer.

name: Pugh|exercise_2_26
nl_statement: Prove that a set $U \subset M$ is open if and only if none of its points are limits of its complement.

name: Pugh|exercise_2_32a
nl_statement: Show that every subset of $\mathbb{N}$ is clopen.

name: Pugh|exercise_2_46
nl_statement: Assume that $A, B$ are compact, disjoint, nonempty subsets of $M$. Prove that there are $a_0 \in A$ and $b_0 \in B$ such that for all $a \in A$ and $b \in B$ we have $d(a_0, b_0) \leq d(a, b)$.

name: Pugh|exercise_2_92
nl_statement: Give a direct proof that the nested decreasing intersection of nonempty covering compact sets is nonempty.

name: Pugh|exercise_3_1
nl_statement: Assume that $f \colon \mathbb{R} \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$ satisfies $|f(t)-f(x)| \leq|t-x|^{2}$ for all $t, x$. Prove that $f$ is constant.

name: Pugh|exercise_3_63a
nl_statement: Prove that $\sum 1/k(\log(k))^p$ converges when $p > 1$.

name: Pugh|exercise_4_15a
nl_statement: A continuous, strictly increasing function $\mu \colon (0, \infty) \rightarrow (0, \infty)$ is a modulus of continuity if $\mu(s) \rightarrow 0$ as $s \rightarrow 0$. A function $f \colon [a, b] \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$ has modulus of continuity $\mu$ if $|f(s) - f(t)| \leq \mu(|s - t|)$ for all $s, t \in [a, b]$. Prove that a function is uniformly continuous if and only if it has a modulus of continuity.

name: Herstein|exercise_2_1_18
nl_statement: If $G$ is a finite group of even order, show that there must be an element $a \neq e$ such that $a=a^{-1}$.

name: Herstein|exercise_2_1_26
nl_statement: If $G$ is a finite group, prove that, given $a \in G$, there is a positive integer $n$, depending on $a$, such that $a^n = e$.

name: Herstein|exercise_2_2_3
nl_statement: If $G$ is a group in which $(a b)^{i}=a^{i} b^{i}$ for three consecutive integers $i$, prove that $G$ is abelian.

name: Herstein|exercise_2_2_6c
nl_statement: Let $G$ be a group in which $(a b)^{n}=a^{n} b^{n}$ for some fixed integer $n>1$ for all $a, b \in G$. For all $a, b \in G$, prove that $\left(a b a^{-1} b^{-1}\right)^{n(n-1)}=e$.

name: Herstein|exercise_2_3_16
nl_statement: If a group $G$ has no proper subgroups, prove that $G$ is cyclic of order $p$, where $p$ is a prime number.

name: Herstein|exercise_2_5_23
nl_statement: Let $G$ be a group such that all subgroups of $G$ are normal in $G$. If $a, b \in G$, prove that $ba = a^jb$ for some $j$.

name: Herstein|exercise_2_5_31
nl_statement: Suppose that $G$ is an abelian group of order $p^nm$ where $p \nmid m$ is a prime.  If $H$ is a subgroup of $G$ of order $p^n$, prove that $H$ is a characteristic subgroup of $G$.

name: Herstein|exercise_2_5_43
nl_statement: Prove that a group of order 9 must be abelian.

name: Herstein|exercise_2_5_52
nl_statement: Let $G$ be a finite group and $\varphi$ an automorphism of $G$ such that $\varphi(x) = x^{-1}$ for more than three-fourths of the elements of $G$. Prove that $\varphi(y) = y^{-1}$ for all $y \in G$, and so $G$ is abelian.

name: Herstein|exercise_2_7_7
nl_statement: If $\varphi$ is a homomorphism of $G$ onto $G'$ and $N \triangleleft G$, show that $\varphi(N) \triangleleft G'$.

name: Herstein|exercise_2_8_15
nl_statement: Prove that if $p > q$ are two primes such that $q \mid p - 1$, then any two nonabelian groups of order $pq$ are isomorphic.

name: Herstein|exercise_2_10_1
nl_statement: Let $A$ be a normal subgroup of a group $G$, and suppose that $b \in G$ is an element of prime order $p$, and that $b \not\in A$. Show that $A \cap (b) = (e)$.

name: Herstein|exercise_2_11_7
nl_statement: If $P \triangleleft G$, $P$ a $p$-Sylow subgroup of $G$, prove that $\varphi(P) = P$ for every automorphism $\varphi$ of $G$.

name: Herstein|exercise_3_2_21
nl_statement: If $\sigma, \tau$ are two permutations that disturb no common element and $\sigma \tau = e$, prove that $\sigma = \tau = e$.

name: Herstein|exercise_4_1_34
nl_statement: Let $T$ be the group of $2\times 2$ matrices $A$ with entries in the field $\mathbb{Z}_2$ such that $\det A$ is not equal to 0. Prove that $T$ is isomorphic to $S_3$, the symmetric group of degree 3.

name: Herstein|exercise_4_2_6
nl_statement: If $a^2 = 0$ in $R$, show that $ax + xa$ commutes with $a$.

name: Herstein|exercise_4_3_1
nl_statement: If $R$ is a commutative ring and $a \in R$, let $L(a) = \{x \in R \mid xa = 0\}$. Prove that $L(a)$ is an ideal of $R$.

name: Herstein|exercise_4_4_9
nl_statement: Show that $(p - 1)/2$ of the numbers $1, 2, \ldots, p - 1$ are quadratic residues and $(p - 1)/2$ are quadratic nonresidues $\mod p$.

name: Herstein|exercise_4_5_23
nl_statement: Let $F = \mathbb{Z}_7$ and let $p(x) = x^3 - 2$ and $q(x) = x^3 + 2$ be in $F[x]$. Show that $p(x)$ and $q(x)$ are irreducible in $F[x]$ and that the fields $F[x]/(p(x))$ and $F[x]/(q(x))$ are isomorphic.

name: Herstein|exercise_4_6_2
nl_statement: Prove that $f(x) = x^3 + 3x + 2$ is irreducible in $Q[x]$.

name: Herstein|exercise_5_1_8
nl_statement: If $F$ is a field of characteristic $p \neq 0$, show that $(a + b)^m = a^m + b^m$, where $m = p^n$, for all $a, b \in F$ and any positive integer $n$.

name: Herstein|exercise_5_3_7
nl_statement: If $a \in K$ is such that $a^2$ is algebraic over the subfield $F$ of $K$, show that a is algebraic over $F$.

name: Herstein|exercise_5_4_3
nl_statement: If $a \in C$ is such that $p(a) = 0$, where $p(x) = x^5 + \sqrt{2}x^3 + \sqrt{5}x^2 + \sqrt{7}x + \sqrt{11}$, show that $a$ is algebraic over $\mathbb{Q}$ of degree at most 80.

name: Herstein|exercise_5_6_14
nl_statement: If $F$ is of characteristic $p \neq 0$, show that all the roots of $x^m - x$, where $m = p^n$, are distinct.

name: Artin|exercise_2_3_2
nl_statement: Prove that the products $a b$ and $b a$ are conjugate elements in a group.

name: Artin|exercise_2_8_6
nl_statement: Prove that the center of the product of two groups is the product of their centers.

name: Artin|exercise_3_2_7
nl_statement: Prove that every homomorphism of fields is injective.

name: Artin|exercise_3_7_2
nl_statement: Let $V$ be a vector space over an infinite field $F$. Prove that $V$ is not the union of finitely many proper subspaces.

name: Artin|exercise_6_4_2
nl_statement: Prove that no group of order $p q$, where $p$ and $q$ are prime, is simple.

name: Artin|exercise_6_4_12
nl_statement: Prove that no group of order 224 is simple.

name: Artin|exercise_10_1_13
nl_statement: An element $x$ of a ring $R$ is called nilpotent if some power of $x$ is zero. Prove that if $x$ is nilpotent, then $1+x$ is a unit in $R$.

name: Artin|exercise_10_6_7
nl_statement: Prove that every nonzero ideal in the ring of Gauss integers contains a nonzero integer.

name: Artin|exercise_10_4_7a
nl_statement: Let $I, J$ be ideals of a ring $R$ such that $I+J=R$. Prove that $I J=I \cap J$.

name: Artin|exercise_11_2_13
nl_statement: If $a, b$ are integers and if $a$ divides $b$ in the ring of Gauss integers, then $a$ divides $b$ in $\mathbb{Z}$.

name: Artin|exercise_11_4_6a
nl_statement: Prove that $x^2+x+1$ is irreducible in the field $\mathbb{F}_2$.

name: Artin|exercise_11_4_6c
nl_statement: Prove that $x^3 - 9$ is irreducible in $\mathbb{F}_{31}$.

name: Artin|exercise_11_13_3
nl_statement: Prove that there are infinitely many primes congruent to $-1$ (modulo $4$).

name: Artin|exercise_13_6_10
nl_statement: Let $K$ be a finite field. Prove that the product of the nonzero elements of $K$ is $-1$.

name: Dummit-Foote|exercise_1_1_2a
nl_statement: Prove the the operation $\star$ on $\mathbb{Z}$ defined by $a\star b=a-b$ is not commutative.

name: Dummit-Foote|exercise_1_1_4
nl_statement: Prove that the multiplication of residue class $\mathbb{Z}/n\mathbb{Z}$ is associative.
